text:
Is it possible to just return the value from a default module? For example:

```{% module "linked_image" path="@HubSpot/linked_image" %}```
I’d like to only return the `src` rather than rendering the entire markup
Thanks <@U7SL518D6>! Do you know if there is a way to turn a field in a template to a repeater? Is there a prop that must be passed through the module?
It sounds like you should honestly create a custom module at that point. That would be a better practice.
I’m so close here :sweat_smile: <@U7SL518D6> – is it impossible?

Technically it’s possible in your template to have repeater like functionality by using a combo of default modules but it’s not a good experience for you as a developer or for the content creator.

It is much better to just make a module with a repeater field.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/module-theme-fields-overview#repeaters>
I guess I could do that, the issue is that I need only the data from the custom module at the template context.

Which takes me to this line: _“The other aspect is visual. If you need to visually hide the module’s output you could build the module to not output anything, or include a boolean field that enables or disables whether the module is renders anything.”_
Well I answered my own question! Figured it out! Thanks <@U7SL518D6>
